alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lafayette; Panola; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 03 at 7:56AM CST until January 03 at 8:45AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Lafayette County in northwestern Mississippi... Yalobusha County in northwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Calhoun County in northeastern Mississippi... Tallahatchie County in northwestern Mississippi... Southeastern Panola County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 845 AM CST. * At 755 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Paynes, or 11 miles southwest of Charleston, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oxford, Water Valley, Charleston, George Payne State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, Coffeeville, Webb, Sumner, Pope, Enid, Paynes, Springdale, Burgess, Banner, Velma, Scobey, Paris, Oakland, Courtland and Taylor. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
